snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron announced on Thursday that he would pursue his own proposal for a system of self-regulation after months of inquiries into a phone-hacking scandal.
abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron says cross-party talks with other political leaders on regulating Britain’s rambunctious tabloid press have broken down and that he will pursue his own proposal for system of self-regulation after months of inquiries into phone hacking scandal.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and JOHN F. BURNS

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister David Cameron announced on Thursday that he would pursue his own proposal for a system of self-regulation after months of inquiries into a phone-hacking scandal.

headline.seo: British Talks on Press Regulation Break Down
headline.main: Talks in Britain on Press Regulation Break Down
headline.print_headline: Talks in Britain on Press Regulation Break Down
